intro: Microlicia urceolata, commonly known as the cup-shaped microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its unique, cup-shaped inflorescence that resembles a small bowl. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Microlicia urceolata is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display.
